task.title: Creating Index Subheadings
task.shortdesc: You can organize a group of indexes together under a subheading. You can add another list tag within the established list (anywhere in the list is fine).

step.cmd: Nest a ‘list’ tag within an ‘item’ tag.
Within the 'list' tag add an 'item' tag. So the breadcrumb trail would be item>lists>item(s). Each 'item' tag wraps around each index entry (it’s content is the index term).
Step 3: Add a <ref> tag to the items in the list.
step.info: The 'ref' tag has a target attribute, whose value is a space seperated list of paragraph XML IDs. The 'ref' tag references the paragraphs in the body text.

step.cmd: Begin to add your index terms between the item/ref tags.
Once you have added all the index terms for your documents begin to note down what paragraph(s) that each index term is located.
Add the XML ids (from the paragraph(s) or other tags) in the target attribute of the <ref> tag. If there are multiple XML ids related to the index term, separate these with a space.
